Truth: you can't climb the ladder of success with your hands in your pockets. You also probably can't climb it. Ladders are hard.
Truth: five-year plan? Most people can't even plan a dinner without three group chats.
Truth: if you're not failing, you're not trying hard enough. If you are failing, you're probably just failing.
Truth: work smarter, not harder — which is advice from someone who no longer has your job.
Truth: believe in yourself. Nobody else will, but statistically someone has to.
Truth: every accomplishment starts with the decision to try and an email chain that should have been a Slack message.
Truth: you are the average of the five people you spend the most time with. Look around. Concerning.
Truth: at least the apocalypse comes with no performance reviews.
Truth: happiness is a warm blanket, a cup of coffee, and complete avoidance of your responsibilities.
Truth: opportunity knocks once. Regret is free and shows up uninvited every night at 3 AM.
Truth: not all those who wander are lost. Some are just hopelessly without GPS signal.
Truth: live laugh love. Die confused, mid-reply to an email you never finished.
Truth: your best days are ahead of you. They're just really far ahead.
Truth: turn your wounds into wisdom. Or just let them fester and become a personality.
Truth: the glass isn't half empty or half full. It's just overpriced.
Truth: adults are just children who owe money.
Truth: monday is just a reminder that the weekend happened too fast and reality lasts too long.
Truth: aging is just a reminder that time only moves in one direction and it's never helpful.
Truth: follow your dreams — right after you finish this mandatory training module.
Truth: they say every person is a story. Some stories are just out of print.
Truth: your comfort zone is lovely. Consider never leaving it.
Truth: the market can stay irrational longer than you can stay solvent.
Truth: everything happens for a reason. Unfortunately, the reason is usually boring and preventable.
Truth: hustle culture sold you a dream. You bought a lifestyle. You got a burnout.
Truth: adulting: the ongoing experience of realizing your parents had no idea what they were doing either.
Truth: your résumé is a work of fiction. Your career is the disappointing sequel.
Truth: networking: the art of pretending to like people who might one day make you less unemployed.
Truth: the only constant in life is change. Also taxes. And meetings that could have been emails.
Truth: fake it till you make it — or until someone competent finds out.
Truth: somewhere, someone is doing what you always said you would do someday.
Truth: the early bird gets the worm. The worm, however, had a really bad morning.
Truth: balance is a myth sold by people who can afford cleaners.
Truth: go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Or stay. The couch is right there.
Truth: if plan A doesn't work, the alphabet has 25 more letters. But so do anxiety disorder symptoms.
Truth: you have 86,400 seconds in a day. Use them to scroll social media and wonder where the time goes.
Truth: the best time to start was yesterday. The second best time is also yesterday because today you're tired.
Truth: every flower must grow through dirt. Every adult must grow through an unmanageable inbox.
Truth: they say shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll be in space — dead, but technically impressive.
Truth: surround yourself with those who see greatness within you. They're called therapists. They bill hourly.
Truth: motivation is temporary. Debt is forever.
Truth: if you don't have anything nice to say, you'll do well in performance reviews.
Truth: self-care is important. So is rent. Unfortunately they've both gotten expensive.
Truth: success is just misery with better Instagram lighting.
Truth: productivity is just the ability to postpone your existential crisis until after the deadline.
Truth: be the change you wish to see in the world. But be warned: the world won't thank you.
Truth: not everyone gets a trophy anymore. Now they just get participation anxiety.
Truth: you're not stuck in traffic. You are traffic. This metaphor works better than your life plan.
Truth: your potential is limitless. Your actual output is another story.
Truth: every great story begins with someone in over their head. You're off to a great start.
Truth: rise and grind — or just rise, make coffee, and stare at the wall for twenty minutes.
Truth: the universe doesn't care about your feelings. Neither does your landlord.
Truth: work hard in silence. Let your silence speak for itself. Forever.
Truth: not all who wander are lost. Some have just given up navigation entirely.
Truth: do what you love and you'll never work a day in your life. Technically that's also called unemployment.
Truth: live in the moment. The bills will patiently wait.
Truth: the road less traveled is probably less traveled for a reason.
Truth: they say the best things in life are free. They've clearly never paid for parking.
Truth: some people say 'I can't do this.' Others say 'I can do this.' Most are lying.
Truth: your dreams are valid. So is the panic attack you'll have trying to achieve them.
Truth: progress is impossible without change. Change is also really annoying.
Truth: keep your head high and your expectations low.
Truth: the people who say money can't buy happiness have clearly never paid off a debt.
Truth: you don't have to be great to start, but you might want to figure that out before the investor meeting.
Truth: the secret to happiness is low expectations and a reliable Wi-Fi connection.
Truth: you can't pour from an empty cup. Good thing your cup was never really full to begin with.
Truth: work like there's no tomorrow. Because statistically, your job may not be there by then.
Truth: life begins at the end of your comfort zone. So does most of the chaos.
Truth: stop waiting for Friday. Start dreading Monday earlier, so you have more time to prepare.
Truth: everything is figureoutable! Just probably not by you, today, with your current energy levels.
Truth: aim high. Miss by a lot. Be humbled. Repeat.
Truth: the only way to fail is to never try. You've been very safe.
Truth: make your dreams a reality — after you take care of the thirty other realities competing for your attention.
Truth: time flies when you're procrastinating on something important.
Truth: you've got one life. Spend a significant portion of it buffering.
Truth: your passion project would make a great hobby if it didn't need to pay rent.
Truth: life is short. Naps are shorter. Choose wisely.
Truth: you could be anything you wanted to be. The window for that closed quietly a few years ago.
Truth: be yourself. Unless yourself is terrible at this, in which case, workshop it.
Truth: positive thinking works! So does planning, preparation, and not making it weird.
Truth: your choices got you here. They can get you further from here too. Careful.
Truth: today will be great! Or mundane. It's honestly a coin toss most days.
Truth: if you're reading motivational quotes to get motivated, you might be in trouble.
Truth: the fastest way to a man's heart is through his chest. Figuratively, please.
Truth: if life gives you lemons, someone else already has a better lemonade stand.
Truth: strive to be great. Settle for adequate. Accept fine. Submit to mediocre. Eventually stop caring.
Truth: they say you can sleep when you're dead. Scientists confirm this is actually the only time.
Truth: the good news: you are unique. The bad news: so is everyone else.
Truth: success is a journey, not a destination. That's what people say when the destination never arrives.

Honest thought: they say the best things in life are free. They've clearly never paid for parking.

Honest thought: keep your head high and your expectations low.

Honest thought: the secret to happiness is low expectations and a reliable Wi-Fi connection.

Honest thought: your choices got you here. They can get you further from here too. Careful.

Honest thought: if you're reading motivational quotes to get motivated, you might be in trouble.

Honest thought: they say you can sleep when you're dead. Scientists confirm this is actually the only time.

Honest thought: success is a journey, not a destination. That's what people say when the destination never arrives.
Let's be real: dreams are free. The hustle is sold separately, at a price you probably can't afford.
Let's be real: if at first you don't succeed, maybe failure is your thing. Own it.
Let's be real: you are uniquely you — which is to say, precisely what the algorithm predicted.
Let's be real: hard work pays off eventually. Laziness pays off right now.
Let's be real: the light at the end of the tunnel may be an oncoming train. Proceed accordingly.
Let's be real: deep down, everyone is ordinary. Some people just have better publicists.
Let's be real: today is the first day of the rest of your increasingly mediocre life.
Let's be real: before you set a goal, ask yourself: do you really want to be disappointed in a new way?
Let's be real: you're not behind in life. There's no finish line. Just an endless treadmill.

Let's be real: success is just failure that hasn't happened yet.
Let's be real: teamwork: sharing blame evenly since forever.
Let's be real: innovation: solving problems that didn't exist before you created them.
Let's be real: your passion is someone else's Monday morning meeting.
Let's be real: the road to success is paved with good intentions and the bones of the easily discouraged.

Let's be real: five-year plan? Most people can't even plan a dinner without three group chats.

Let's be real: work smarter, not harder — which is advice from someone who no longer has your job.
Let's be real: believe in yourself. Nobody else will, but statistically someone has to.

Let's be real: aging is just a reminder that time only moves in one direction and it's never helpful.

Let's be real: they say every person is a story. Some stories are just out of print.

Let's be real: adulting: the ongoing experience of realizing your parents had no idea what they were doing either.

Let's be real: networking: the art of pretending to like people who might one day make you less unemployed.
Let's be real: the only constant in life is change. Also taxes. And meetings that could have been emails.
Let's be real: fake it till you make it — or until someone competent finds out.
Let's be real: somewhere, someone is doing what you always said you would do someday.
Let's be real: the early bird gets the worm. The worm, however, had a really bad morning.
Let's be real: balance is a myth sold by people who can afford cleaners.
Let's be real: go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Or stay. The couch is right there.
Let's be real: if plan A doesn't work, the alphabet has 25 more letters. But so do anxiety disorder symptoms.
Let's be real: you have 86,400 seconds in a day. Use them to scroll social media and wonder where the time goes.
Let's be real: the best time to start was yesterday. The second best time is also yesterday because today you're tired.
Let's be real: every flower must grow through dirt. Every adult must grow through an unmanageable inbox.
Let's be real: they say shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll be in space — dead, but technically impressive.
Let's be real: surround yourself with those who see greatness within you. They're called therapists. They bill hourly.
Let's be real: motivation is temporary. Debt is forever.
Let's be real: if you don't have anything nice to say, you'll do well in performance reviews.

Let's be real: productivity is just the ability to postpone your existential crisis until after the deadline.

Let's be real: not everyone gets a trophy anymore. Now they just get participation anxiety.

Let's be real: your potential is limitless. Your actual output is another story.
Let's be real: every great story begins with someone in over their head. You're off to a great start.
Let's be real: rise and grind — or just rise, make coffee, and stare at the wall for twenty minutes.

I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised.
Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything.
I'm reading a book about anti-gravity. It's impossible to put down.
Did you hear about the mathematician who's afraid of negative numbers? He'll stop at nothing to avoid them.
Why do cows wear bells? Because their horns don't work.
I asked my dog what two minus two is. He said nothing.
I don't trust stairs. They're always up to something.
Why did the scarecrow win an award? He was outstanding in his field.
I used to hate facial hair, but then it grew on me.
Parallel lines have so much in common. It's a shame they'll never meet.
A skeleton walks into a bar and orders a beer and a mop.
I tried to make a belt out of watches once. It was a waist of time.
The problem with kleptomaniacs is that they always take things literally.
My wife told me I had to stop acting like a flamingo. I had to put my foot down.
A man walks into a library and asks for books about paranoia. The librarian whispers, 'They're right behind you.'
Why don't eggs tell jokes? They'd crack each other up.
I have a joke about construction, but I'm still working on it.
What do you call cheese that isn't yours? Nacho cheese.
I'm on a seafood diet. I see food and I eat it.
Why did the bicycle fall over? It was two-tired.
Time flies like an arrow. Fruit flies like a banana.
author: Groucho Marx

text: I have not slept for ten days, because that would be too long.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
author: Groucho Marx

text: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
author: Steve Martin

text: All the things I really like to do are either immoral, illegal, or fattening.
author: Alexander Woollcott

text: It's a small world, but I wouldn't want to have to paint it.
author: Steven Wright

text: If you think you are too small to be effective, you have never been in the dark with a mosquito.
I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

text: The only mystery in life is why the kamikaze pilots wore helmets.
author: Al McGuire

text: The scientific theory I like best is that the rings of Saturn are composed entirely of lost airline luggage.
author: Mark Russell

text: The average dog is a nicer person than the average person.
author: Andy Rooney

text: If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?
Do Lipton Tea employees take coffee breaks?
Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: The brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
author: Robert Frost

text: Before you criticize someone, walk a mile in their shoes. That way, you'll be a mile from them and have their shoes too.
If you must choose between two evils, pick the one you've never tried before.
I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
author: Charles Lamb

text: I used to think I was indecisive, but now I'm not too sure.
Evening news is where they begin with 'Good evening,' and then proceed to tell you why it isn't.
The hardest thing in the world to understand is income taxes.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
author: Bob Hope

text: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
author: Timothy Leary

text: By the time a man realizes that his father was right, he has a son who thinks he's wrong.
author: Charles Wadsworth

text: The only time a woman really succeeds in changing a man is when he's a baby.
author: Natalie Wood

text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
author: Jim Carrey

text: If at first you don't succeed, skydiving is not for you.
The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: I intend to live forever. So far, so good.
author: Steven Wright

text: There's a fine line between cuddling and holding someone down so they can't get away.
I have a lot of growing up to do. I realized that the other day inside my fort.
author: Zach Galifianakis

text: If I'm not back in five minutes, just wait longer.
author: Ace Ventura

text: Light travels faster than sound. This is why some people appear bright until you hear them speak.
The early bird gets the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
author: Willie Nelson

text: I'm not superstitious, but I am a little stitious.
author: Michael Scott

text: Dentist's appointment? I'd rather deal with the tooth hurty.
I could tell you a chemistry joke but I know I wouldn't get a reaction.
What do you call a factory that makes okay products? A satisfactory.
I tried to write a joke about the ocean. It just waved.
Did you hear about the hungry clock? It went back four seconds.
What do you get when you cross a snowman and a vampire? Frostbite.
Why did the coffee file a police report? It got mugged.
I only know 25 letters of the alphabet. I don't know y.
What do you call a fake noodle? An impasta.
I would tell you a pizza joke but it's too cheesy.
I'm reading a great book about teleportation. It's bound to take you places.
A photon checks into a hotel. The bellhop asks, 'Can I help you with your luggage?' The photon replies, 'No thanks, I'm traveling light.'
I told my doctor I broke my arm in two places. He told me to stop going to those places.
author: Henny Youngman

text: You know you're getting old when you get that one candle on the cake. It's like, 'See if you can blow this out.'
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it.
author: Buddy Hackett

text: We are all here on earth to help others. What on earth the others are here for, I don't know.
author: W.H. Auden

text: I'm not good at the advice. Can I interest you in a sarcastic comment?
author: Chandler Bing

text: The four most beautiful words in our common language: I told you so.
author: Gore Vidal

text: Two fish are in a tank. One says, 'How do we drive this thing?'
I can resist everything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Always borrow money from a pessimist. They'll never expect it back.
I've been on a diet for two weeks and all I've lost is 14 days.
I'm not lazy, I'm in energy saving mode.
I put the 'fun' in 'dysfunctional.'
My therapist told me the way to achieve true inner peace is to finish what I start. So far today, I have finished two bags of M&Ms and a chocolate cake.
author: Dave Barry

text: Go to heaven for the climate, hell for the company.
author: Mark Twain

text: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The world is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
author: Horace Walpole

text: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
author: Mel Brooks

text: If you want to be sure that you never forget your wife's birthday, just try forgetting it once.
Accept who you are. Unless you're a serial killer.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: That's the true spirit of Christmas; people being helped by people other than me.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: The key to a successful dinner party? Alcohol and low expectations.
The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others, whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I've had a perfectly wonderful evening. But this wasn't it.
author: Groucho Marx

text: If you want something done right, do it yourself. If you want something done at all, lower your standards.
I'm not arguing, I'm just explaining why I'm right.
Common sense is a flower that doesn't grow in everyone's garden.
The older you get, the better you get. Unless you're a banana.
author: Betty White

text: My wife just found out I replaced our bed with a trampoline; she hit the roof.
Change is not a four letter word... but often your reaction to it is.
author: Jeffrey Gitomer

text: Why do men's clothes have buttons on the right but women's on the left? Because women's brains work differently — there's always a twist.
I used to think I was indecisive, but now I'm not so sure.
There are three kinds of people in this world: those who can count and those who can't.
The best kind of laughter is the kind where you laugh even after you've stopped.
Today, I decided to be the adult in the room. Truly awful experience. Would not recommend.
I'm writing a book about reverse psychology. Don't buy it.
Sometimes I think I understand everything. Then I regain consciousness.
I'm not clumsy. The floor just hates me. Walls get in my way. And tables have it out for my shins.
Technically, I can do anything I set my mind to. But technically, I can also not.
I'll quit coffee when they invent something better. I'll also quit when someone makes me.
Doing nothing is very hard to do. You never know when you're finished.
author: Leslie Nielsen

text: If I agreed with you, we'd both be wrong.
Don't worry about the world coming to an end today. It's already tomorrow in Australia.
author: Charles Schulz

text: I hate when people say they're 'a little OCD' about something. That's not how this works. That's not how any of this works.
I'm at that awkward age where I'm too old for a juice box and too young for a coffin.
People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
author: A.A. Milne

text: A good lawyer knows the law. A great lawyer knows the judge.
Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The road to success is dotted with many tempting parking spaces.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you're going to tell people the truth, be funny or they'll kill you.
author: Billy Wilder

Koalas and humans are the only animals with unique fingerprints.
The world's longest river — the Nile — flows northward into the Mediterranean Sea.
The Sun contains 99.86% of the mass of the entire solar system.
A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance, and they turn pink from the food they eat.
Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backward.
The first computer password was probably created by Fernando Corbató at MIT in the 1960s.
Venus rotates so slowly that a day on Venus is longer than its year.
Some species of bamboo can grow up to 35 inches in a single day.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all Earth's beaches.
The leaning Tower of Pisa was never actually straight — it began to lean during construction.
Frogs absorb water through their skin, not their mouths.
A group of otters in the water is called a raft.
The first electronic computer, ENIAC, weighed 30 tons and took up 1,800 square feet.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
The giant Pacific octopus has three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, one pumps it to the body.
Light from the Sun takes about 8 minutes and 20 seconds to reach Earth.
A group of meerkats is called a gang or mob.
Honeybees communicate directions to food through a waggle dance.
The shortest intercontinental flight is approximately 14 minutes — between Gibraltar and Morocco.
Cats have a specialized collarbone that allows them to always land on their feet.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth and can be seen from space.
Elephants can detect rainfall up to 150 miles away and will migrate toward it.
The human body contains about 37.2 trillion cells.
Gold is so rare that all the gold ever mined could fit into about three and a half Olympic swimming pools.
Mushrooms are more closely related to animals than to plants.
The first ATM was installed in London in 1967.
Dolphins have names for each other — specific whistles that identify individuals.
A butterfly's wings are actually transparent — the colors come from the reflection of tiny scales.
Penguins spend up to 75% of their life in the water.
The average cloud floats at an altitude between 6,500 and 20,000 feet.
More people are killed by falling coconuts than by sharks each year.
The T-Rex existed closer in time to us than to the Stegosaurus.
There are more atoms in a teaspoon of water than teaspoons of water in the Atlantic Ocean.
Dolphins will sometimes play with and care for other species' young.
The longest fingernails ever grown belonged to Lee Redmond — they measured over 28 feet combined.
The first person convicted of speeding was doing 8 mph in 1896.
Bees have five eyes — two compound and three simple — giving them a field of nearly 300 degrees.
The average human heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
The total length of the world's coastlines is over 500,000 kilometers.
A nautical mile is slightly longer than a land mile — 1.15 miles or 1.85 km.
There are approximately 7.5 quintillion grains of sand on Earth's beaches.
A group of narwhals is called a blessing.
The loudest sound ever recorded was the 1883 eruption of Krakatoa, heard 3,000 miles away.
Cuttlefish can change the texture of their skin to mimic objects around them.
The blue-ringed octopus carries enough venom to kill 26 adults within minutes.
The world's largest living organism is a honey fungus in Oregon covering 2,385 acres.
There are over 8 million tons of plastic in the ocean, equivalent to dumping a garbage truck's worth every minute.
A group of badgers is called a cete.
The ocean contains over 20 million tons of dissolved gold.
Horses can sleep standing up.
Camels have three eyelids to protect against sandstorms.
The word 'serendipity' was coined by Horace Walpole in 1754 based on a Persian fairy tale.
The longest word in any major English dictionary has 45 letters.
There are more microorganisms in a teaspoon of healthy soil than people on Earth.
Octopuses can edit their own RNA to adapt to temperature changes.
The first photograph took eight hours of exposure to develop.
A group of hedgehogs is called a prickle.
Parrots are one of the few animals capable of true vocal mimicry of human speech.
Porcupine quills are actually modified hairs made of keratin.
The smallest bone in the human body is the stapes in the ear, about 3mm long.
Goldfish can recognize their owners' faces and even be trained to do tricks.
Cats have a third eyelid called a nictitating membrane that protects their eyes.
The world's largest recorded snowflake was 15 inches in diameter and fell in Montana in 1887.
Lobsters communicate by urinating at each other — through nozzles in their faces.
Turtles breathe through their butts — technically, they absorb oxygen through a process called cloacal respiration.
Stars don't actually twinkle — it's the Earth's atmosphere that causes the visual effect.
A group of crows working together is called a conspiracy.
The original name for the Frisbee was the Pluto Platter.
Chameleons are native to Africa and Madagascar, not the rainforests of South America.
Sloths can take up to a month to digest a single meal.
The electric eel is not actually an eel — it's more closely related to carp.
